site_name: Land Forming Part Of Acton Goods Yard
description: Construction of a rail served concrete batching plant (CBP), rail served cement storage  facility (4no cement / PFA storage silos), workshop, modular office/welfare facilities, aggregate storage bays, substation and other ancillary structures and parking areas to enable use of site for concrete batching, cement storage and distribution, and associated administrative activities (proposals to enable permanent relocation of existing CBP operation, workshop and administrative activities from Quattro site at Park Royal).
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved drawings and documents: Site Location Plan H12277-PL1C, Existing Site Plan / Elevation H12277-PL2C, Proposed Site Plan / Elevation H12277-PL3R, Proposed Site Boundary Fence H12277-PL4E, Cement / PFA Silo Elevation H12277-10D, Office Building Plan / Elevation H12277-11C, Vehicle Workshop Plan / Elevation H12277-12A, CBP Plan / Elevation Sheet 1 H12277-13.1J, CBP Plan / Elevation Sheet 2 H12277-13.2H, CBP Plan / Elevation Sheet 3 H12277-13.3F, Cycle Store H12277-14C, Pedestrian / Vehicle Access Route H12277-15C, Refuse Area H12277-16B, Wheel Wash H12277-17D, Modular Office H12277-18C, Modular Office H12277-19C,

Planning Statement July 2019, Design and Access Statement July 2019, Ecological Appraisal May 2019, Transport Assessment April 2019, Servicing and Delivery Plan April 2019,  Parking Management Plan April 2019, Air Quality Assessment April 2019, Noise Impact Assessment by Sharps Gayler April 2019, Supplementary Noise Assessment by Sharps Gayler dated 21 October 2019, Phase 1 Land Contamination Assessment April 2019, Sustainability Statement and Energy Assessment April 2019, Statement of Community Involvement December 2018, Townscape and Visual Impact Assessment April 2019, Surface Water and Sustainable Urban Drainage Strategy Rev A dated 27/09/19.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Details of the materials and finishes to be used for all external surfaces of the buildings and structures within the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority before any part of the development is commenced (excluding ground investigation works, demolition and site clearance, remediation of any contamination, preliminary infrastructure works, site preparation and erection of temporary boundary fencing or hoarding) and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with these approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the materials and finishes are of high quality and contribute positively to the visual amenity of the locality in accordance with policies 1.1 (h) (g), 1.2(h), 2.1(c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies ELV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Details of the boundary treatment for the site including the acoustic barrier on the northern boundary shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority before any part of the development (excluding ground investigation works, demolition and site clearance, remediation of any contamination, preliminary infrastructure works, site preparation and erection of temporary boundary fencing or hoarding) is commenced and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. The approved boundary treatment shall be installed prior to the first use of the development hereby approved and shall be retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area and residential amenity of prospective occupiers, and in accordance with policies 3.5, 7.4, and 7.21 of the London Plan (2016), policies 1.1 (h) (g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(b) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies ELV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved, a demolition method statement and a construction management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council. Details shall include idetification of a construction lorry route to the site from the main distributor roads (A40 and A4020), the number of construction-related vehicles travelling to the application site, swept path envelopes for construction lorries in and out of the access road, abnormal load delivery vehicle routes and dates of these deliveries, control measures for dust, noise, vibration, lighting, delivery locations, restriction of hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays and 0800 -1300 hrs on Saturdays, advance notification to immediate neighbours on Horn Lane, Lynton Road and Lowfield Road of proposed works and public display of contact details including accessible phone contact to persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works. Approved details shall be implemented throughout the project period.

Reason:  To protect the amenity of neighbouring occupiers, to ensure adequate highway and site safety in accordance with policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j) and 2.1(c) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 6.3, 6.13, 7.13, 7.14 and 7.15  of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2019), Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise. | Details of cycle parking facilities for the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of the development (excluding ground investigation works, demolition and site clearance, remediation of any contamination, preliminary infrastructure works, site preparation and erection of temporary boundary fencing or hoarding). The development shall be implemented only in accordance with these approved details prior to the first occupation of the development and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To promote sustainable patterns of transport, in accordance with Section 9 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and policies 6.3, 6.9, 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2016. | A Green Travel Plan designed to manage the transport needs of the occupiers of the development, including measures to minimise car useage, promote alternative modes of transport, and progressively reduce the proposed car parking spaces to 11, shall be submitted to and approved  by the Local Planning Authority before the first occupation of the development. The approved Green Travel Plan shall be fully implemented in compliance with the approved document.

Reason: To promote sustainable patterns of transport to safeguard the living and working conditions of local people and in the interest of highway and pedestrian safety, in accordance with section 9 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2019), policies 6.3, 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016) and policies 1.1 (f) and 1.1(g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2026. | Prior to commencement of the development (excluding ground investigation works, demolition and site clearance, remediation of any contamination, preliminary infrastructure works, site preparation and erection of temporary boundary fencing or hoarding), updated plans shall be submitted for written approval by the local planning authority to show the number to staff car parking spaces reduced to 21.
The areas allocated for parking on the submitted plans shall be kept clear of obstruction and shall not be used other than for parking of vehicles in connection with the development hereby permitted.

Reason: In the interests of highway/pedestrian safety and an appropriate operation of the development in accordance with policies 1.1(e) and 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A  of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 6.11, 6.12 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | The staff car parking spaces hereby approved shall be fully marked out and provision of 4 active electric vehicle charging point spaces with the remaining parking spaces provided with passive points in accordance with TfL parking standards shall be made the prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved, and these car parking spaces together with the associated access and internal carriageway shall be kept continuously available for the satisfactory operation of the parking area and shall not be used for any other purpose.

Reason: To reduce emissions of greenhouse gases and to improve local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2, 5.2 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(e), 1.1(f), 1.1(j) and 1.2(k) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | The use hereby permitted, with the exception of the delivery of material by rail and unloading, shall operate only between the hours of 0700 to 1830 on Mondays to Fridays and 0700 to 1730 on Saturdays with no working on Sundays or Bank Holidays.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of future occupiers of the site and occupiers of nearby properties, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | There shall be no HGV vehicle movements to and from the site other than between the hours of 0700 to 1830 on Mondays to Fridays and 0700 to 1730 on Saturdays and at no time on Sundays or Bank Holidays.

Reason: Having regard to the impact on neighbouring amenity and to accord with Policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2016. | There shall be no more than an average of 160 HGV movements per day to and from the site on a five day average (Monday to Friday), with a maximum of 200 HGV movements (i.e. 100 in and 100 out) on any one day.

Reason: To ensure the safety of pedestrians and vehicles and the amenities of the surrounding area and to comply with policies 6.3 and 6.14 of the London Plan 2016. | A revised Parking Management Plan to reflect the reduced level of employee car parking to 21 spaces shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the first operation of the development hereby approved. The development shall thereafter be operated only in accordance with the approved Parking Management Plan.

Reason: To promote sustainable patterns of transport, in accordance with Section 9 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2018) and policies 6.3, 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2016. | The development shall be operated in accordance with the submitted Servicing and Delivery Plan (by Bellamy Roberts dated April 2019) for the duration of the use hereby approved unless the prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority is obtained to any variation.

Reason: To ensure the safety of pedestrians and vehicles and the amenities of the surrounding area in accordance with section 9 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2019), policies 6.3, 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016) and policies 1.1 (f) and 1.1(g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2026. | All vehicles operating from the site or supplying the site with materials shall be fitted with white noise reversing sounders and no other reversing sounders shall be used on the site, unless first agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. These white noise reversing sounders shall be used at all times while the site is operational.

Reason: To ensure the safety of pedestrians and vehicles and the amenities of the surrounding area and to comply with policies 6.3 and 6.14 of the London Plan 2016 and and policies 1.1 (f) and 1.1(g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2026. | Mitigation measures shall be implemented to ensure that the external sound level LAeq emitted from fixed plant, machinery / equipment will be lower than the lowest existing background sound level LA90 by at least 5dBA at the most noise sensitive receiver location. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014 and SPG10, with all fixed plant items operating individually and together as intended, at maximum capacity. Details of any noise mitigation measures shall be submitted for approval. A post installation sound assessment shall be carried out where required to confirm compliance with the noise criteria and additional steps to mitigate noise shall be taken, as necessary.  Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To safeguard future and existing occupiers of the area against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy (2012), Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document t (2013). | Mitigation measures shall be implemented to ensure that the external sound level LAeq emitted from external noise sources such as transport and commercial/industrial uses/activities and their noise levels at residential facades are in accordance with the Supplementary Noise Assessment (by Sharps Gayler dated 21 October 2019). These shall include mitigation measures as necessary to achieve noise standards of BS8233:2014 and SPG10 at residential facades and external amenity spaces. The mitigation measures shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Prior to use, machinery, plant or equipment at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of future occupiers of the site and occupiers of nearby properties, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Prior to commencement of the development (excluding ground investigation works, demolition and site clearance, remediation of any contamination, preliminary infrastructure works, site preparation and erection of temporary boundary fencing or hoarding), details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council, of the sound insulation of the building envelope for the vehicle workshop, the cleaning station for concrete and material holding or delivery drums/containers/tankers and other buildings housing noise sources, together with other mitigation measures, as appropriate.  Details shall demonstrate that noise from uses and activities is contained within the buildings and does not exceed the criteria of BS8233:2014 at neighbouring noise sensitive premises and private external amenity spaces, as assessed according to criteria of SPG10. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | No vehicle engines shall be left running while vehicles used in conjunction with the development are stationary at the site.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise or fumes in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Prior to commencement of the development (excluding ground investigation works, demolition and site clearance, remediation of any contamination, preliminary infrastructure works, site preparation and erection of temporary boundary fencing or hoarding), details of any new external artificial lighting to be installed shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council. Lighting contours shall be submitted to demonstrate that the vertical illumination of neighbouring premises is in accordance with the recommendations of the Institution of Lighting Professionals in the 'Guidance Notes For The Reduction Of Light Pollution 2011'.  Details should also be submitted for approval of measures to minimise use of lighting and prevent glare and sky glow by correctly using, locating, aiming and shielding luminaires. The lighting shall utilise LED bulbs and shall only be used between the hours of 0700 to 1830 on Mondays to Fridays and 0700 to 1730 on Saturdays and at no time on Sundays or Bank Holidays. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by lighting in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 5.4 and 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | All Non-Road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) to be used in the development site shall meet as a minimum the Stage IIIB emission criteria of Directive 97/68/EC and its subsequent amendments, unless it can be demonstrated that Stage IIIB equipment is not available. An inventory of all NRMM shall be registered on the NRMM register at https://nrmm.london/user-nrmm/register. All NRMM shall be regularly serviced and service logs kept on site for inspection. Records shall be kept on site detailing proof of emissions standards for all equipment.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of nearby occupiers in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | No microwave masts, antennae or satellite dishes or any other plant or equipment shall be installed on any elevation of the buildings hereby permitted without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason:  To safeguard the appearance of the buildings and the locality in the interests of visual amenity in accordance with policies 1.1 (h), 1.1 (g), 1.2(h), 2.1(c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan (2016), and sections 7 and 12 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | No breaking out of hardened concrete inside truck mixer drums shall take place on the site.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of future occupiers of the site and occupiers of nearby properties, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | The use hereby permitted shall not include any aggregate crushing or concrete recycling and no such activity shall take place on the site.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of nearby occupiers in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | The loads of any vehicles transporting concrete from the concrete batching plant shall be enclosed, contained or otherwise covered and sheeted so as to prevent concrete spillage and dust or other emmisions from the loads.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of nearby occupiers in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes H and I of Part 7 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country England) Order 2015 (or any other Order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no erection, extension or alteration of an industrial building, no additional plant or replacement plant or machinery (except for like for like replacement for the purposes of repair and maintenance) nor the provision, rearrangement or replacement (except for like for like replacement for the purposes or repair and maintenance) of a conveyor shall be carried out within the application site without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building, in accordance with policies 5.20 and 7.1 of the London Plan, policies 1.1(j) and 2.4 of the Ealing Development (or Core) Strategy and policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document. | Prior to commencement of the development (excluding ground investigation works, demolition, site clearance, remediation of any contamination, preliminary infrastructure works, site preparation and erection of temporary  boundary fencing or hoarding), details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council of a suitable dust emissions control scheme (Dust Management Plan) that includes enclosure for parts of concrete batching plant (CBP), as detailed in the application submission and drawings of the rail served concrete batching plant (CBP), rail served cement storage facility (4 x cement / PFA storage silos), to enable the use of site for concrete batching, cement storage and distribution. Under such a scheme, silos shall be fitted with filters of appropriate emission rates (5mg/m3 or lower).

Reason: To safeguard the external amenity and public health of future occupants of nearby residential properties and improve future air quality in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016), and to enable the Local Planning Authority to deliver its commitments on the emerging climate change strategy and deliver reductions  of CO2 and other emissions through sustainable design and construction. | Prior to the erection of the bulk cement silos, details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Council of the loading/unloading delivery system for the bulk storage facility. The silos should be designed to ensure that it is not possible to unload more than 6 rail wagons at any one time (this will be limited by the number of connection points provided to the silos - so that no more than 6 delivery pipes can be coupled at any one time). There shall be a limit of four deliveries of cement per week. Verifiable records of scheduled deliveries loading/unloading of cement should be held electronically and made available to the Local Planning Authority at regular intervals (quarterly) from commencement of operation of the bulk cement storage and distribution facility. The continuing requirement for recording and reporting loading/unloading of cement shall be reviewed and submitted to the Local Planning Authority on an annual basis for final discharge of this part of the condition.

Reason: To safeguard the external amenity and public health of future occupants of nearby residential properties and improve future air quality in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016), and to enable the Local Planning Authority to deliver its commitments on the emerging climate change strategy and deliver reductions  of CO2 and other emissions through sustainable design and construction. | No development (excluding ground investigation works, demolition, site clearance, remediation of any contamination, preliminary infrastructure works, site preparation and erection of temporary boundary fencing or hoarding) shall take place until details of mitigation measures to reduce elevated concentrations of nitrogen oxides and particulate matter have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To safeguard the external amenity and public health of future occupants of nearby residential properties and improve future air quality in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016), and to enable the Local Planning Authority to deliver its commitments on the emerging climate change strategy and deliver reductions  of CO2 and other emissions through sustainable design and construction. | Monitoring of PM10 and PM2.5 concentrations at the site boundary shall be undertaken at a single site using an Osiris sampler (or equivalent). Additionally, monitoring of nitrogen dioxide concentrations shall also be undertaken at two sites at the site boundary using passive diffusion tubes. Monitoring shall commence simultaneously with commencement of plant operations. Monitoring data shall be reported to the Local Planning Authority at regular intervals (quarterly). Should concentration levels increase significantly, taking into account the accuracy and precision of the monitoring methods and background/regional fluctuations, further mitigation measures shall be discussed/implemented with the Local Planning Authority. The continuing requirement for monitoring shall be reviewed and submitted to the Local Planning Authority on an annual basis for final discharge of this condition.

Reason: To safeguard the external amenity and public health of future occupants of nearby residential properties and improve future air quality in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016), and to enable the Local Planning Authority to deliver its commitments on the emerging climate change strategy and deliver reductions  of CO2 and other emissions through sustainable design and construction. | Access to the adjoining railway station shall not be blocked by works associated with the development and should there be any times where restricted access is implemented, Network Rail and MTR shall be provided with access to the station in order to maintain the operation of the station as well as in case of an emergency.

Reason: To ensure the development does not affect the safety and continued running of the neighbouring railway. | During the course of the construction and carrying out of the approved development, if any unforeseen contamination not previously identified is found at any time during clearance or construction works, it must be reported without delay to the Local Planning Authority. The development shall not proceed further until an assessment of that contamination and the preferred remediation measures to remove or break the relevant pollutant linkage has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that any ground and water contamination is identified and adequately addressed to ensure the safety of the development, the environment, to ensure the site is suitable for the proposed use and to protect the health and living conditions of residents in the area in accordance policy 5.21 of The London Plan (2016), policy 1.1( j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and the National Planning Policy Framework, DEFRA and the Environment Agency's 'Model Procedures for the Management of Land Contamination, CLR 11' and BS1075:2011+A1:2013.
